page.title: 13BROOK PRIMARY SCHOOL 1
page.content: Brook Primary School was built in 1876, but wasn't opened until 1877.It is a small village school which still has the original window panes. It consists of 2 mobiles and one classroom. Altogether, in the whole school there are 44 children.The first teacher at the school was there for 30 years. The next teacher was there for only 6 years as she wasn't very good. Then another teacher came and was there for 40 years.There are still air-raid shelters at the school left from World War 2 where the present headteacher found photographs and old school records which is how we know the history of the school. The infants are between 5 and 7 and the juniors 8 and 11.Most children live locally but some travel from other areas as they prefer a village school.
